verses.text: Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the rolls, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
And there was found at Achmetha, in the palace that \add is\add* in the province of the Medes, a roll, and therein \add was\add* a record thus written:

In the first year of Cyrus the king \add the same\add* Cyrus the king made a decree \add concerning\add* the house of God at Jerusalem, Let the house be builded, the place where they offered sacrifices, and \add let\add* the foundations thereof \add be\add* strongly laid; the height thereof threescore cubits, \add and\add* the breadth thereof threescore cubits;
\add with\add* three rows of great stones, and a row of new timber: and let the expences be given out of the king’s house:

and also let the golden and silver vessels of the house of God, which Nebuchadnezzar took forth out of the temple which \add is\add* at Jerusalem, and brought unto Babylon, be restored, and brought \add again\add* unto the temple which \add is\add* at Jerusalem, \add every one\add* to his place, and place \add them\add* in the house of God.
Now \add therefore\add*, Tatnai, governor beyond the river, Shethar-boznai, and your companions the Apharsachites, which \add are\add* beyond the river, be ye far from thence:
let the work of this house of God alone; let the governor of the Jews and the elders of the Jews build this house of God in his place.

Moreover I make a decree what ye shall do to the elders of these Jews for the building of this house of God: that of the king’s goods, \add even\add* of the tribute beyond the river, forthwith expences be given unto these men, that \add they\add* be not hindered.

And that which \add they\add* have need of, both young bullocks, and rams, and lambs, for the burnt offerings of the God of heaven, wheat, salt, wine, and oil, according to the appointment of the priests which \add are\add* at Jerusalem, let \add it\add* be given them day by day without fail:
that they may offer sacrifices of sweet savours unto the God of heaven, and pray for the life of the king, and of his sons.
Also I have made a decree, that whosoever shall alter this word, let timber be pulled down from his house, and being set up, let him be hanged thereon; and let his house be made a dunghill for this.

And the God that hath caused his name to dwell there destroy all kings and people, that shall put to their hand to alter \add and\add* to destroy this house of God which \add is\add* at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree; let it be done with speed.
Then Tatnai, governor on \add this\add* side the river, Shethar-boznai, and their companions, according to that which Darius the king had sent, so they did speedily.

And the elders of the Jews builded, and they prospered through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. And they builded, and finished \add it\add*, according to the commandment of the God of Israel, and according to the commandment of Cyrus, and Darius, and Artaxerxes king of Persia.
And this house was finished on the third day of the month Adar, which \add was in\add* the sixth year of the reign of Darius the king.
And the children of Israel, the priests, and the Levites, and the rest of the children of the captivity, kept the dedication of this house of God with joy,

and offered at the dedication of this house of God an hundred bullocks, two hundred rams, four hundred lambs; and for a sin offering for all Israel, twelve he goats, according to the number of the tribes of Israel.
And they set the priests in their divisions, and the Levites in their courses, for the service of God, which \add is\add* at Jerusalem; as it is written in the book of Moses.
And the children of the captivity kept the passover upon the fourteenth \add day\add* of the first month.

For the priests and the Levites were purified together, all of them \add were\add* pure, and killed the passover for all the children of the captivity, and for their brethren the priests, and for themselves.

And the children of Israel, which were come again out of captivity, and all such as had separated themselves unto them from the filthiness of the heathen of the land, to seek the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, did eat,

and kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with joy: for the \sc Lord\sc* had made them joyful, and turned the heart of the king of Assyria unto them, to strengthen their hands in the work of the house of God, the God of Israel.
